intro: Pseudostellaria okamotoi var. longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-pedicellate starwort, is a flowering plant species native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are typically opposite and oval-shaped. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
